name.ch: 社會參與之導航與探索

goal.ch:
看過《八尺門的辯護人》了嗎？

這部小說和影集承載了許多議題，例如漁工、移工、族群、廢死、司法、海洋資源、地緣政治等等。然而，這些沉重的議題除了正式的論辯攻防之外，也有詼諧幽默的片段傳達出草根生活的無奈。清代的詩人袁枚曾說過：「以樂景寫哀，以哀景寫樂，倍增其哀樂之感。」《八尺門的辯護人》以這些議題的組合說了個好故事。

本課程為「跨領域社會參與學分學程」之導航課程。我們可以把課程內容想像為另一種版本的《八尺門的辯護人》，為了說好這個故事，我們必須對於真實的社會議題有所了解。社會參與的精神即在於：藉由關注社會議題的過程，啟發跨域學習與創意思考的熱情，並在團隊合作以投身於真實場域及提出解決方案的同時，透過自我探索進而發現學習意義。

本課程為多元化教學形式，除了課堂講授之外，也會在分組教師的帶領下進行小組討論、校外參訪，並邀請業師進行實例分享。部分校外參訪將於週末假日進行，全學期以一次為限，具體時間將於課堂上公布。學期成果將以每位同學選定的分組專題呈現，本學期將進行的社會議題將含括司法人權、多元性別、跨境移動、地方創生、原民產業以及部落教育等面向。

goal.en:
Have you seen the Port of Lies?

This novel and movie collection carries many issues, such as fishermen, migrant workers, ethnic groups, abolitionism, justice, marine resources, geopolitics, and so on. However, in addition to the formal debates on these heavy issues, there are also humorous moments that convey the helplessness of grassroots life. Yuan Mei, a poet of the Qing Dynasty, once said, “To write sadness in a happy scene, and to write music in a sad scene, doubles the feeling of sadness and happiness”. the the Port of Lies tells a good story by combining these topics.

This course is an introductory course for the Interdisciplinary Social Engagement Credit Program. We can think of the course content as another version of the Port of Lies. In order to tell a good story, we need to understand the real social issues. The spirit of social engagement is to inspire cross-disciplinary learning and creative thinking through the process of paying attention to social issues, and to discover the meaning of learning through self-exploration while working in teams to engage in real-life situations and propose solutions.

In addition to classroom lectures, group discussions, field trips and case studies will also be conducted under the leadership of group teachers. Some off-campus visits will take place during weekends and holidays, and will be limited to one visit per semester, with specific times announced in class. The results of the semester will be presented in a group project chosen by each student. The topics of this semester‘s social conference will include human rights, gender diversity, cross-border mobility, local creation, indigenous industries, and tribal education.
